title: 70s Bantam paperback font
content:
This shows up on a ton of paperbacks from Bantam in this era. It is not quite Profil/Decorated 035--it lacks that oblique touch.

[http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/6513/thebarbarouscoastax0.jpg](http://web.archive.org/web/20100224082458/http:/img90.imageshack.us/img90/6513/thebarbarouscoastax0.jpg "http://img90.imageshack.us/img90/6513/thebarbarouscoastax0.jpg")

Any ideas?
author: mbcohen

comments.content:
That time period probably means a film type was used. It's a slab/Egyptian style, similar to [Glypha](http://web.archive.org/web/20100224082458/http:/new.myfonts.com/fonts/linotype/glypha/), but a bit condensed. It's rather hard to find these with middle serifs on the E, and that's why I picked Glypha as a similar font.

- Mike Yanega
Yes, thank you, that is looking quite close. I can probably fake it. Thanks!
Looking closer... it's those capital "O"s that are unusual. They're somewhat elongated.
